text: we spend more time online than ever
before and researchers starting to show
just how bad this can be for our brain
and mental health for this reason it's
becoming increasingly popular to step
away from Tech and do a digital detox
what is a digital detox well a digital
detox is kind of like a fast but instead
of not eating you don't use your phone
or any other digital devices and you
especially avoid social media today
we'll look at three benefits this can
bring for you with that being said let's
Jump Right In benefit number one is that
doing a digital detox makes you more
creative a study was conducted back in
2012 the researchers sent a group of
students away on a three-day camping
trip without any devices to see how that
would affect the problem-solving skills
the students were all given a creativity
test half of the group took it before
the trip and the other half took it
after the researchers predicted that the
students who took the test after the
trip might only do slightly better but
they were surprised to find that they
actually did much better more than 50
percent better overall another study in
2022 looked at 250 students in Japan it
found that participants did much better
on a variety of creativity tests when
they spent some time daydreaming instead
of looking at digital media why is this
well it turns out that doing nothing can
actually be good for you our brain
benefits from taking a break from having
to process outside information all day
however the devices in constant access
to social media we have these days makes
it so we are always absorbing outside
information we fill every spare moment
with distractions whenever we're
commuting waiting in line or even on the
toilet we pull out our phones to keep
our minds occupied whether it's reading
emails checking notifications or
scrolling through feeds on social media
author Cal Newport calls this Solitude
deprivation if we don't give ourselves
time to daydream and recharge we will
miss the crucial benefits of letting our
minds relax and wander by letting our
minds relax and wander we can get much
better results when we start working on
the next task this is why it isn't
always good to use our phones when
taking a break from a challenging
project it might feel like a good way to
unwind but it actually prevents your
brain from taking a crucial break the
pictures news and stories about other
people stress your brain in a variety of
ways preventing it from relaxing benefit
number two digital detoxing resets your
dopamine levels increasingly research
shows that overusing social media can
cause depression and anxiety and one
possible reason is the dopamine spikes
it gives us dopamine is a chemical in
the brain that's often called the
pleasure chemical because when it's
released we feel good it's natural for
our dopamine levels to rise and fall
throughout the day but social media
especially apps like Tick Tock are
designed to keep us hammering away on
the dopamine button flooding our brain
with the pleasure chemical again and
again when this happens our respect
chapters get over stimulated and we
start needing more stimulation to feel
the same thing if we don't we start
feeling negative emotions such as
anxiety and sadness but here's the good
news even a short digital detox can
reset your brain and return your
dopamine to a healthy level psychiatrist
and dopamine expert Anna Lemke says
you'll probably feel pretty bad for the
first day or two but once you're over
that hump you'll start feeling the
benefits of a detox she says patients
who undergo a detox begin noticing it
they can take much more pleasure from
the little things in life like reading
or going for a hike Studies have also
found that detoxers start feeling
happier overall people who try a digital
detox also find that when they begin
using their Tech again they can use it
in moderation instead of obsessively if
you do a digital detox you'll have a lot
more free time on your hands which means
you can work on your personal hygiene

now back to the topic at hand and
finally benefit number three digital
detoxing improves your attention the
human brain is an amazing organ and one
of its superpowers is how plastic it is
neuroplasticity as it's called means
that your brain can change and grow when
you learn new things or practice
something over and over again it's sort
of like a muscle that gets stronger when
you exercise so when you learn new
skills like riding a bike or playing a
musical instrument your brain makes new
connections between its cells which
makes it easier for you to do these
things but this plasticity comes with a
downside have you ever felt like it's
getting harder to pay attention over the
years the problem with social media is
that if we use it too much we get used
to the constant stream of pings likes
and new content and eventually our brain
adapts and learns to expect stimulation
every seconds over time we start finding
it near impossible to focus on things
for long periods of time this is
plasticity in action and research shows
that it's responsible for our attention
spans getting shorter for example one
study found that heavy social media
users had less gray matter in parts of
their brain that deal with focus and
control and even light users showed some
of the same effects the upside of our
brains being plastic is that with a
digital detox we can reverse the damage
and give our attention a boost once we
get used to spending time without the
constant stimulation that social media
provides we start being able to focus on
more difficult but rewarding tasks like
learning a skill or studying for an exam
and this isn't just theoretical a 2019
study of 60 participants found that a
two-week digital detox significantly
improved the subject's attention and
self-regulation skills but some
improvements were also seen after just a
few days and there you have it these are
three ways a digital talks can change
your brain for the better if you've
never tried doing a digital detox before
I hope this video encourages you to give
it a go let me know how that goes for
